Math_Problem: Regular hexagon $P_{1} P_{2} P_{3} P_{4} P_{5} P_{6}$ has side length 2. For $1 \leq i \leq 6$, let $C_{i}$ be a unit circle centered at $P_{i}$ and $\ell_{i}$ be one of the internal common tangents of $C_{i}$ and $C_{i+2}$, where $C_{7}=C_{1}$ and $C_{8}=C_{2}$. Assume that the lines $\{\ell_{1}, \ell_{2}, \ell_{3}, \ell_{4}, \ell_{5}, \ell_{6}\}$ bound a regular hexagon. The area of this hexagon can be expressed as $\sqrt{\frac{a}{b}}$, where $a$ and $b$ are relatively prime positive integers. Compute $100 a+b$. Instead of determining the value 100 times the numerator plus the denominator for the area of the bounded regular hexagon when expressed as the square root of a reduced fraction, simply find $k$, the denominator of that reduced fraction. Find all square numbers $ S_1$ and $ S_2$ such that $ S_1 - S_2 = k + 1986$.

Connecting_Sentence.A2095: Instead of determining the value 100 times the numerator plus the denominator for the area of the bounded regular hexagon when expressed as the square root of a reduced fraction, simply find $k$, the denominator of that reduced fraction.

Synthesised_By.A2095: Regular hexagon $P_{1} P_{2} P_{3} P_{4} P_{5} P_{6}$ has side length 2. For $1 \leq i \leq 6$, let $C_{i}$ be a unit circle centered at $P_{i}$ and $\ell_{i}$ be one of the internal common tangents of $C_{i}$ and $C_{i+2}$, where $C_{7}=C_{1}$ and $C_{8}=C_{2}$. Assume that the lines $\{\ell_{1}, \ell_{2}, \ell_{3}, \ell_{4}, \ell_{5}, \ell_{6}\}$ bound a regular hexagon. The area of this hexagon can be expressed as $\sqrt{\frac{a}{b}}$, where $a$ and $b$ are relatively prime positive integers. Compute $100 a+b$. Instead of determining the value 100 times the numerator plus the denominator for the area of the bounded regular hexagon when expressed as the square root of a reduced fraction, simply find $e = k + 1986$, where $k$ is the denominator of that reduced fraction.

Synthesised_By.A4334: Find all square numbers $ S_1$ and $ S_2$ such that $ S_1 \minus{} S_2 \equal{} 1989.$

Original_Problem.A2095: Regular hexagon $P_{1} P_{2} P_{3} P_{4} P_{5} P_{6}$ has side length 2. For $1 \leq i \leq 6$, let $C_{i}$ be a unit circle centered at $P_{i}$ and $\ell_{i}$ be one of the internal common tangents of $C_{i}$ and $C_{i+2}$, where $C_{7}=C_{1}$ and $C_{8}=C_{2}$. Assume that the lines $\{\ell_{1}, \ell_{2}, \ell_{3}, \ell_{4}, \ell_{5}, \ell_{6}\}$ bound a regular hexagon. The area of this hexagon can be expressed as $\sqrt{\frac{a}{b}}$, where $a$ and $b$ are relatively prime positive integers. Compute $100 a+b$.

lines l_1 to l_6 bound regular hexagon H
M midpoint P1 P3, P1 M = sqrt(3)
T1 tangency point l_1 on C1, P1 T1 = 1, P1 T1 perpendicular to l_1
angle at T1 in triangle P1 M T1 = 90 degrees
Q foot of perpendicular from O to l_1, h = O Q, angle at Q in triangle O M Q = 90 degrees

side s of H = 2 h / sqrt(3)

for each pair, a = (d + e)/2 and b = (e - d)/2 are integers
